instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P not woirking.
It was water damaged.Did ultrasonic cleaning, check with good known 
all cables and i/o card but no luck.

compare with good known mb Diode mode measurement all are good,  except J4800 pin2 is .441 but the
good one mb show me OL. So i checked <RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR>=33 OHM , looks good and <RESISTOR>R1666</RESISTOR>=25k but it should be 47k
i replaced this but still it shows me 25k, 

p1 smc lid=3.3v
p10=3.3v
p14=5.1v
p19=3.3v
Now i stuck, dont knoe what the next i should check. Any help please.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message:
Check first if you can access boot menu.

"<RESISTOR>R1666</RESISTOR>=25k but it should be 47k
i replaced this but still it shows me 25k,"
Onboard mesurement for rsistance depends by other resistors/components connected in the same lines.

"J4800 pin2 is .441 but the
good one mb show me OL"
Checked with red probe to ground on both cases?

Post diode mode value (red to ground) for pin 2/6 of <CHIP>U4810</CHIP>.
Check all resistors <RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR>-53 from TPAD SPI lines.

Where was the spill?
Check continuity from J4800 to other components.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message:
I found missing <RESISTOR>R4844</RESISTOR>, replase it now t/p working fine with the following measurement
<CHIP>U4810</CHIP> (diode mode ) p2=.509 and p6=.432.
Still i see j4800 p2=.441 and it should be OL compare to good one. and my battery is not detected.
I tried two battery. All other functions of the mac  are working except Battery. Any suggestions please.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message: Post SCL/SDA diode mode values on battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message:
Values are correct.
Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage w/ and w/o battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage w/ = 8.57v
and w/o battery connected=8.57v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message:
Unless battery is 100% charged, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> should have lower value when battery is connected.

Run ASD, let see if any error appears...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message: Now i stuck, i don't  have ASD for Macbook air 11 2014, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, any body can help me please.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message: Is there any ASD for Macbook Air 11 2014, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message:
No idea really, never used for this model.
Did you change <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?
Check voltage on A/BMON of it; both battery and charger connected.
Also check exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message:
Thanks for replying.
No, i dint  change ISL. 
 voltage on AMON p9=   .171 ( only charger connected )
voltage on BMON p15=   .172 ( only charger connected )

voltage on AMON p9=  .172      ( battery connected )
voltage on BMON p15=   .104   ( battery connected )

resistance between pins 17/18= 2.4 ohm
resistance between pins 27/28=20 ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message:
Can you see any communication on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
I think is time to change the SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message: All communication on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus are good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message:
Check if <RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> is OK.
Battery connector was affected by spill too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR>  =10k looks good . I check battery connector looks clean

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B kb and T/P are not working.
threads.message: Right now i dont have SMC, i will post latter when i will get it , Thanks for your assistance.
